alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 11:56AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Owsley, northwestern Leslie, northern Perry, northwestern Knott, west central Floyd, Breathitt, southern Magoffin and northeastern Clay Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1156 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Taff to Whick to Carver. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Swampton, Carver, Carver Station, Duco, Conley Station, Tiptop, Watts, Chavies, Clayhole and Hardshell around 1200 PM EDT. Gapville, Fredville, Ordway, Ned, Waldo, Lamont, Rowdy, Krypton, Morris Fork and Evanston around 1205 PM EDT. Hazard, Buckhorn, Dice, Orchard, Gunlock and Dalesburg around 1210 PM EDT. Saul, Pyramid, Hueysville, Bulan, Sizerock, Hippo, Panco, Ary, Talcum and Buckhorn Lake S.P. around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Estill, Ritchie, Kaliopi, Langley, Shoal, Fisty, Cordia, Emmalena, Eastern, Confluence, Hindman, Wayland, Dryhill, Printer, Hunter, Elic, Toulouse, Carrie, Drift, Minnie, Avawam, Leburn and Garner. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 44 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 7. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 20. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry
